citation.article-title: Paracoccus isoporae sp. nov., isolated from the reef-building coral Isopora palifera
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paracoccus isoporae sp. nov.
Paracoccus isoporae (i.so.por′ae. N.L. gen. n. isoporae of Isopora, a genus of coral, from which the strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, aerobic, rod shaped (0.5–0.7×0.7–1.5 µm) and motile by means of monopolar flagella.
Colonies are a creamy white colour, circular and convex with entire edges and are ~0.6–0.8 mm in diameter on MA after 48 h of incubation at 30 °C.
Growth occurs at 4–40 °C (optimum 25–30 °C), pH 7–10 (optimum pH 9–10) and in 0–12 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 3–5 %).
Positive for oxidase, catalase and DNase activities and hydrolysis of aesculin and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80.
Negative for lipase activity (hydrolysis of corn oil) and hydrolysis of casein, starch, alginate and chitin.

In API 20 NE tests: positive for aesculin hydrolysis and β-galactosidase activity; negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, gelatin hydrolysis, d-glucose fermentation and arginine dihydrolase and urease activities.

In API ZYM tests: positive for alkaline phosphatase, C4 esterase, C8 esterase lipase, C14 lipase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α- and β-galactosidase, α- and β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase activities; negative for cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, β-glucouronidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase activities.

The following compounds are utilized as sole carbon sources in the GN2 microplate: dextrin, Tweens 40 and 80, l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, α-d-glucose, α-lactose, lactulose, maltose, d-mannitol, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid monomethyl ester, α-, β and γ-hydroxybutyric acid, 2,3-butanediol and glycerol.
All other substrates in the GN2 microplate are not utilized.
Sensitive to rifampicin, nalidixic acid, kanamycin, chloramphenicol, gentamicin, novobiocin, streptomycin, tetracycline, ampicillin, penicillin G and sulphamethoxazole plus trimethoprim.
The predominant cellular fatty acid is summed feature 8 (C18 : 1ω7c and/or C18 : 1ω6c).
The major respiratory quinone is Q-10.
The polar lipids are DPG, PG, PC, an unidentified aminolipid (AL1), two unidentified glycolipids (GL1 and GL2) and four unidentified phospholipids (PL1–4).
The type strain, SW-3T ( = LMG 25205T = BCRC 17967T), was isolated from a reef-building coral, Isopora palifera, collected off the coast of Southern Taiwan.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.7 mol%.
